body:
### Steps to reproduce

So far I've only seen this in job batch scripts and not in interactive terminals, but I don't know what the difference is yet.

These scripts have a line that looks something like `. /ccs/home/carns/working/src/spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh`, with the path varying depending on where spack is located.

This command reports a failure, though spack appears to work correctly afterwards if you script is not too picky about checking return codes.


### Error message

```
/ccs/home/carns/working/src/spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh: line 143: unalias: despacktivate: not found
```

### Information on your system

```
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.17.1-915-c11ce3bd1f
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel8-power9le
* **Concretizer:** clingo
```
This is from the Summit system at the OLCF, but we have seen the same error on at least two entirely different systems at ANL.

### General information

- [X] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [X] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
title: "unalias: despacktivate: not found" error in setup-env.sh
